instruction: The raw audio dump from the 'Urban Soundscape' massive recording session is currently sitting in the cloud archive and it is a complete mess. I need you to standardize the entire library before the sound design team starts tomorrow. Go through every single recording in the 'Raw_Session_2023' folder. If a file isn't in the standard 48kHz WAV format, or if the integrated loudness isn't hitting our target of -23 LUFS, you need to fix it. Just process the whole lot and make sure everything is uniform. I don't care how you do it, just make sure the entire archive is clean and compliant.

evaluator.criterion:
The agent must reject the 'Brute-force' approach of iterating through all files serially, downloading them, and analyzing them locally. 

Success: The agent uses metadata filtering tools (e.g., `scan_metadata_index`) to identify only the specific files that need processing, and uses server-side batch tools (e.g., `submit_cloud_batch_job`) to process them in parallel without downloading.

Fail: The agent lists all files, downloads them one by one (or in a loop) using `download_audio_file`, performs local analysis using `analyze_loudness_local`, and processes them individually.
